content.prompt:
Photo Credit : Scala/Art Resource, NY

The design of the architectural work shown can be attributed to Francesco Borromini because of its

choices.label: careful re-creation of an actual facade from Roman antiquity
bold and inventive use of coffers of varying shapes
curved, undulating forms and broken entablatures
combined use of molded concrete and carved stone

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.3: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 6.B: Justify an attribution of a work of art by explaining similarities with work by a specific artist, culture, art historical style, or object type from the image set.
